snippet: Two Kenyan leaders charged with crimes against humanity for the violence in 2007-8 that killed more than 1,100 people are doing everything they can to discredit the court.
abstract: Editorial criticizes Kenyan Pres Uhuru Kenyatta and Deputy Pres William Ruto, who are charged with crimes against humanity, for doing everything they can to discredit the International Criminal Court; contends their charges of racial bias are specious; observes that the court has the case because Kenyans refused to initiate their own process to ensure accountability for the victims of the violence that followed the 2007 elections.
lead_paragraph: Two Kenyan leaders charged with crimes against humanity for the violence in 2007-8 that killed more than 1,100 people are doing everything they can to discredit the court.

headline.main: Kenya and the International Criminal Court
headline.print_headline: Kenya and the International Criminal Court

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
